potentialUsesDescription: Describe the problem you think this model could help solve, or one potential app someone could make with this model.
potentialMisusesDescription:
Describe any limitations in how this model was created or how it should be used. You may say things like "Avoid using this model for..." or "Be cautious about...".
Important questions to consider are:
potentialMisusesDescriptionRepresent: Does the data represent all possible users and scenarios?
potentialMisusesDescriptionEnough: Did you gather enough data to be confident in the model's accuracy?
potentialMisusesDescriptionSituations: Are there situations where this model definitely shouldn't be used?
datasetDescriptionPlaceholder: How was the data collected? Who collected it? When was it collected?
dataDisplayRowCountTruncated: There are {rowCount} rows of data. (Showing first {rowLimit} rows)
columnDetailsTooManyLabels: {labelCount} values were found in this column. A graph is only shown when there are {maxLabelCount} or fewer.
selectDatasetErrorTooFewRows: Please upload a {fileType} with at least {count} rows.
selectDatasetErrorTooFewColumns: Please upload a {fileType} with at least {count} columns.
dataCardWarningLargeDataset: Warning: Datasets with more than {rowCount} rows will slow down the user experience.
dataCardRemovedRows: {rowCount} {rowCount, plural, one {row} other {rows}} removed because {rowCount, plural, one {it} other {they}} contained empty cells.
saveStatus_failure: There was an error. Your model did not save. Please try again.
saveStatus_piiProfanity: Your model could not be saved because it contains profanity or personally identifying information (e.g. email, address, phone number).
animationDescriptionsTraining: Labeled rows from the training dataset go into A.I. bot's open head.
animationDescriptionsTesting: A.I. bot scans incoming rows of unlabeled data from the test dataset. As each row moves under A.I. bot's beam, A.I. makes a prediction by adding a value to the label column.
crossTabTooMuchData: The currently-selected data is too large to show in a table.
uniqueOptionsWarningMessage: Categorical columns with more than {valueCount} unique values can not be selected as the label or a feature.

card.description: A dataset of survey responses gathered by Slovak students aged 18-21 at FSEV UK. Most responses are rankings on a scale from 1 to 5. For example, 'Rank from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree): I often study or work even in my spare time'. This is a subset of the larger dataset that just focuses on movies.

context.potentialUses: For example, predict someone's personality traits based on other traits.
context.potentialMisuses: Using demographic information from a limited dataset to make assumptions about subgroups of people: for example, asking predictions about which genders are more likely to have which fears.

school.description: Their school's acronym, GP or MS.

address.description: Student's home address type: U (urban) or R (rural).

family size.description: Family size: LE3(less than or equal to 3) and GT3 (greater than 3)

parent cohabitation status.description: Whether their parents live together (T) or apart (A)

traveltime.description: Student's travel time to school, in hours.

studytime.description: Student's weekly study time, 1 to 10 hours.

failures.description: Number of past class failures (0 to 4).

family relationships.description: Quality of family relationships: 1 (very bad) to 5 (excellent).

freetime.description: Free time after school: 1 (very low) to 5(very high).

go out.description: How often students go out with friends: 1(very rarely) to 5(very often).

daily alcohol.description: Weekday alcohol consumption: 1 (very low) to 5 (very high).

weekend alcohol.description: Weekend alcohol consumption: 1 (very low) to 5 (very high)

card.description: Contains individual responses to a social survey of Portuguese secondary school students, tracking social, gender, and study information.

Buying Price.description: The buying price of the car, from very high to low.

Maintenance Cost.description: The maintenance cost of the car, from very high to low.

Number Of Doors.description: The number of doors, from 2 to 5 or more.

Number of Passengers.description: The number of passengers: 2, 4, or more.

Boot Size.description: The boot (trunk) size: small, medium, or big.

Safety Rating.description: The safety rating: high, medium, or low.

Car Acceptability.description: The acceptability rating of the car: unacceptable, acceptable, good, or very good.

card.description: A dataset of cars ranked on 'acceptability', based on features like price, safety, and number of passengers. The rankings come from a decision model designed by Marko Bohanec.

context.potentialUses: Determine a car's acceptability rating based on certain feature.
context.potentialMisuses: You might have different car criteria than this rating system - this can't make a better decision on car buying than you can! Although it might help you in your search.

index.description: The record's unique index or key. This shouldn't be used as a feature.

Date.description: The date the records were taken.

Season.description: Season: spring, summer, winter or fall.

Holiday.description: Whether or not the day is a holiday.

Day of Week.description: The day of the week: 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).

Workday.description: Whether or not this is a work day.

Weather Description.description: A description of the day's weather, ranging from a few clouds to light snow or rain.

Average Temperature (Celsius).description: Average temperature in Celsius, normalized to a 0 to 1 scale where 0 = -8 degrees celsius and 1 equals 39 degrees celsius.

Average \"Feels Like\" Temperature.description: Average "feels like" temperature in Celsius, normalized to a 0 to 1 scale where 0 = -16 degrees celsius and 1 equals 50 degrees celsius.

Humidity (0 - 1).description: Humidity, normalized to 0 (0% humidity) to 1 (100% humidity).

Number of Casual Users.description: Number of users without an account.

Number of Registered Users.description: Number of users with an account.

card.description: Daily rental data from Washington, D.C.'s Capital Bikeshare system from 2011 and 2012, along with weather data for those days.

context.potentialUses: Predict how many bikes will be rented based on weather conditions, or time of year.

Style.description: The fit or style of jeans, e.g. skinny or boot cut.

Mens or womens.description: Whether the jeans were sold to target men or women.

Cotton contents.description: Amount of cotton in the fabric, where 0 means no cotton at all, and 1 means 100% cotton.

Price in dollars.description: The price of the jeans in US dollars.

Max height of front pocket.description: The height of the front pocket from its deepest part.

Min height of front pocket.description: The height of the front pocket from its most shallow part.

Front rivet height.description: Front pocket openings curve down towards the side of the leg, ending in a rivet. This number measures the distance from the top of the pocket to that rivet.

Max width of front pocket.description: The width of the front pocket from its widest part.

Min width of front pocket.description: The width of the front pocket from its narrowest part.

Max width of back pocket.description: The width of the back pocket from its widest part.

Min width of back pocket.description: The width of the back pocket from its narrowest part.

Max height of back pocket.description: The height of the back pocket from its deepest part.

Min height of back pocket.description: The height of the back pocket from its shallowest part.

card.description: This dataset contains measurement data about popular brands of jeans.

context.potentialUses: Predict the price of a pair of jeans based on who they're for, the size of the pockets, etc.

Dangerous dogs.description: I am afraid of Dangerous dogs

Fear of public speaking.description: I am afraid of  public speaking

card.description: A dataset of survey responses gathered by Slovak students aged 18-21 at FSEV UK. Most responses are rankings on a scale from 1 to 5. For example, 'Rank from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree): I often study or work even in my spare time'. This is a subset of the larger dataset that just focuses on music.

context.potentialUses: For example, predict someone's personality traits based on other traits.
context.potentialMisuses: Using demographic information from a limited dataset to make assumptions about subgroups of people: for example, asking predictions about which genders are more likely to have which fears.

Metal or Hardrock.description: I enjoy Metal or Hardrock music

Fear of public speaking.description: I am afraid of  public speaking

Healthy eating.description: I live a very healthy lifestyle

Daily events.description: I take notice of what goes on around me.

Prioritising workload.description: I try to do tasks as soon as possible and not leave them until last minute.

Writing notes.description: I always make a list so I don't forget anything.

Workaholism.description: I often study or work even in my spare time.

Thinking ahead.description: I look at things from all different angles before I go ahead.

Final judgement.description: I believe that bad people will suffer one day and good people will be rewarded.

Reliability.description: I am reliable at work and always complete all tasks given to me.

Loss of interest.description: I can fall for someone very quickly and then completely lose interest.

Friends versus money.description: I would rather have lots of friends than lots of money.

Funniness.description: I always try to be the funniest one.

Fake.description: I can be two faced sometimes.

Criminal damage.description: I damaged things in the past when angry.

Decision making.description: I take my time to make decisions.

Elections.description: I always try to vote in elections.

Self-criticism.description: I often think about and regret the decisions I make.

Judgment calls.description: I can tell if people listen to me or not when I talk to them.

Eating to survive.description: I eat because I have to. I don't enjoy food and eat as fast as I can.

Giving.description: I try to give as much as I can to other people at Christmas.

Compassion to animals.description: I don't like seeing animals suffering.

Borrowed stuff.description: I look after things I have borrowed from others.

Cheating in school.description: I used to cheat at school.

Changing the past.description: I wish I could change the past because of the things I have done.

New environment.description: I can quickly adapt to a new environment.

Appearence and gestures.description: I am well mannered and I look after my appearance.

Achievements.description: I always let other people know about my achievements.

Responding to a serious letter.description: I think carefully before answering any important letters.

Assertiveness.description: I am not afraid to give my opinion if I feel strongly about something.

Getting angry.description: I can get angry very easily.

Knowing the right people.description: I always make sure I connect with the right people.

Public speaking.description: I have to be well prepared before public speaking.

Unpopularity.description: I will find a fault in myself if people don't like me.

Life struggles.description: I cry when I feel down or things don't go the right way.

Happiness in life.description: I am 100% happy with my life.

Energy levels.description: I am always full of life and energy.

Small - big dogs.description: I prefer big dangerous dogs to smaller, calmer dogs.

Personality.description: I believe all my personality traits are positive.

Finding lost valuables.description: If I find something the doesn't belong to me I will hand it in.

Getting up.description: I find it very difficult to get up in the morning.

Interests or hobbies.description: I have many different hobbies and interests.

Parents' advice.description: I always listen to my parents' advice.

Questionnaires or polls.description: I enjoy taking part in surveys.

Internet usage.description: How much time do you spend online?

Finances.description: I save all the money I can.

Shopping centres.description: I enjoy going to large shopping centres.

Branded clothing.description: I prefer branded clothing to non branded.

Entertainment spending.description: I spend a lot of money on  partying and socializing.

Spending on looks.description: I spend a lot of money on my appearance.

Spending on gadgets.description: I spend a lot of money on gadgets.

Spending on healthy eating.description: I will hapilly pay more money for good, quality or healthy food.

Village - town.description: I spent most of my childhood in a: village or city.

House - block of flats.description: I lived most of my childhood in a: house or block of flats (apartments).

card.description: A dataset of survey responses gathered by Slovak students at FSEV UK. Questions were asked about music, culture, their own phobias, and their demographic information. Most responses are rankings on a scale from 1 to 5. For example, the question 'Do you enjoy listening to music?' offered a scale from 1 (Strongly disagree) to 5 (Strongly agree). This dataset has a huge amount of questions to explore.

context.potentialUses: For example, determine if someone might like a certain type of music based on their other tastes.
context.potentialMisuses: Using demographic information from a limited dataset to make assumptions about subgroups of people: for example, asking predictions about which genders are more likely to have which fears.

Main dish.description: The main dish served at the meal. Most likely turkey.

Main dish cooking method.description: How the main dish was cooked, e.g. baked, roasted, fried.

Stuffing base.description: If stuffing was served, what its major ingredient was, or none if no stuffing was served.

Cranberry sauce.description: The kind of cranberry sauce served.

Gravy.description: Whether or not gravy was served with the meal.

Brussel sprouts.description: Whether or not brussel sprouts were served with the meal.

Carrots.description: Whether or not carrots were served with the meal.

Apple cobbler.description: Whether or not apple cobbler was served as a dessert.

Blondies.description: Whether or not blondies were served as a dessert.

Carrot cake.description: Whether or not carrot cake was served as a dessert.

Cheesecake.description: Whether or not cheese cake was served as a dessert.

Cookies.description: Whether or not cookies were served as a dessert.

Fudge.description: Whether or not fudge was served as a dessert.

Ice cream.description: Whether or not ice cream was served as a dessert.

Peach cobbler.description: Whether or not peach cobbler was served as a dessert.

US region.description: The part of the country the participant was from.

card.description: A survey from FiveThrityEight, asking people across the United States what foods they have for Thanksgiving dinner.

context.potentialUses: Predict whether someone will have a specific food for Thanksgiving, based on the region of the country they are from.
context.potentialMisuses: Trying to guess what region someone is from, just based on the foods they eat on Thanksgiving.

Budget.description: The budget of the film in USD. Films with no budget data have 0 here.

Runtime.description: How long the movie is in minutes.

Score.description: The IMDb user rating for the movie.

Rating.description: The MPAA rating, from G (all ages) to NC-17 (no children under 17).

Released.description: The month it was released in.

Votes.description: Number of votes the movie received in IMDB.

Year.description: The year it was released in.

card.description: A dataset of movies released from 1986-2016, with box office numbers, ratings, IMDB scores, and more.

context.potentialUses: For example, determine a movie's box office by its budget or genre.

Loudness score.description: A scoring of the song's loudness, where low negative numbers like -13 mean relatively quiet, and high negative numbers like -5 mean relatively loud.

Tempo in beats per minute.description: Tempo of the song in beats per minute (BPM). Higher numbers mean faster, more energetic songs.

Duration in seconds.description: Length of the song in seconds.

Year.description: The year the song was released.

Weeks on the Billboard Top 100.description: The total number of weeks the songs was listed on the Billboard Top 100.

Billboard rank peak.description: The highest position the song reached on the Billboard Top 100.

card.description: A random selection of popular songs with and Billboard Top 100 chart information as well as other characteristics.

context.potentialUses: Predict how big of a hit a song was based on its genre and other factors.

For example, 'Rank from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree): I often study or work even in my spare time'. This is a subset of the larger dataset that just focuses on personal interests

context.potentialUses: For example, predict someone's personality traits based on other traits.
context.potentialMisuses: Using demographic information from a limited dataset to make assumptions about subgroups of people: for example, asking predictions about which genders are more likely to have which fears.

bleeding.description: Whether or not the patient was bleeding.

shortness_of_breath.description: Whether or not the patient had shortness of breath.

card.description: Data collected by a hospital on all patients who entered an emergency room over the course of one month.

context.potentialUses: Help determine the priority for people entering an Emergency Room so doctors and nurses can better help people with potentially serious injuries.
context.potentialMisuses: This model shouldn't be used in a way that could reduce the care for people entering an emergency room.

type of employment.description: Type of employment: government, private, self.

estimated number of people represented.description: The estimate for how many people in the US this person is representative of.

occupation.description: What they do for a living.

relationship.description: Relationship description of their marital status.

race.description: Race (uses 1994 racial categories which excludes a number of distinctions).

gender.description: Gender (uses 1994 Census options, which are binary).

capital gains.description: Their reported capital gains for the year (these are monetary gains from things like selling stock instead of income from a job).

capital losses.description: Their reported capital losses (for example, if they sold a stock that lost them money).

income.description: Their income: binary for greater than or less than $50,000.

card.description: Data from the 1994 US census, with income, personal, and job data. Used to predict whether a person's income is over $50,000.

context.potentialUses: Predict whether a person's income is over or under $50,000, based on their education level and age. Demonstrate racial and gender-based income inequality.
context.potentialMisuses: Using this for something like determining whether or not to give someone a loan could be deeply unfair.

Category.description: The general category of food the item belongs to.

Description.description: A full description of the item.

Ash.description: Ash content represents the total mineral content in foods. Measured in grams (g).

Beta Carotene.description: A type of lipid molecule, measured in milligrams (mg).

Carbohydrate.description: Dietary fiber or roughage is the indigestible portion of food derived from plants. It has two main components: soluble fiber and insoluble fiber. Measured in grams (g).

Cholesterol.description: The total number of kilocalories in this food item. A kilocalorie is a unit of energy of 1000 calories (equal to 1 large calorie).

card.description: A dataset compiled by the USDA of various food items and their nutritional content: calories, minerals, vitamins, and a whole lot more.

context.potentialUses: For example, determine how many calories a food has from its nutritional content.

sides.description: Number of sides the shape has

symmetry.description: Is the shape symmetric (like flipping it onto itself and it's the same shape)

equal sides.description: Does the shape have all equal sides?

equal angles.description: Does the shape have all equal angles?

background color.description: Color of the background behind the shape

card.description: Extracted features from a visual dataset showing different shapes.

context.potentialUses: Used to train AI Bot on how to classify shapes.
context.potentialMisuses: Anything other than the purpose above.

spend time.description: Where will you spending most of your time today?

weather.description: What is the weather like today?

day.description: How would you describe your day today?

notice shoes.description: Do you care if people notice your shoes?

shoe.description: What kind of shoes are you planning on wearing today?

card.description: Survey about your preferences to help recommend what kind of shoes you should wear.

context.potentialUses: Recommend a pair of shoes based on personal questions.
context.potentialMisuses: Anything other than the intended uses.

cylinders.description: The number of cylinders in the engine.

model year.description: The year the car was released.

car name.description: The name of the car: all unique values.

card.description: A small dataset of different car statistics, originally from 1983, used to predict their MPG (miles per gallon). This dataset is unlikely to get great accuracy scores on a KNN regression, but it could make a useful model nonetheless: how can you take a general pattern in the model and use that to determine which features contribute to higher miles per gallon? How might you change the dataset to get a more accurate model - for example, changing MPG from a numerical column to a categorical one with intervals of 5 MPG?

context.potentialUses: Determine a car's MPG based on various features like weight and horsepower.
context.potentialMisuses: Since it's 30 years old, it may not reflect advancements in technology - don't buy your car based on this!

Per Capita Crime Rate.description: Per capita crime rate by town.

Proportion of Residental Land Zoned for.id: Proportion of Residental Land Zoned for >25Kft
Proportion of Residental Land Zoned for.description: Proportion of residential land zoned for lots over 25,000 square feet.

Proportion of non-retail business acres.description: Proportion of non-retail business acres per town.

Bounds Charles River?.description: 1 if the land is next to the Charles River, 0 otherwise. Some towns have an 'NA' where the answer is uncertain.

Nitric Oxide Concentration (PPM).description: Nitric oxide concentration in parts per 10 million.

Rooms per dwelling.description: Average number of rooms per dwelling.

% of buildings pre-1940.description: Proportion of owner-occupied units build prior to 1940.

Distance to employment centers.description: Weighted distance to 5 major Boston employment centers.

Accessibility to highways.description: A weighted measure of accessibility to major highways.

Student-teacher ratio.description: The average student to teacher ratio by town.

Weighted black population.description: A weighted measure of the Black population per town.

Lower status population.description: The percent of the population designated as 'lower status'.

card.description: A widely used, small dataset on housing in the Boston, Masachusetts area.

context.potentialUses: Predict median home value based on Black population and parent teacher ratio.
context.potentialMisuses: This is an old dataset, so it's unlikely to reflect contemporary home values. This is also a dataset that reflects racial and economic biases: is it right or fair that home values tended to be higher in areas where the population was more wealthy, or less Black?

activity.description: Which of these activities do you like the most?

personality.description: How do you like to spend your time?

element.description: Which of these elements is your favorite?

make build.description: How do you feel about the following statement: "I like to make and build things with my hands"

meet people.description: How do you feel about the following statement: "I like to learn new things and meet new people"

club.description: What is a club you would want to join or are already a part of?

card.description: Zoey asked everyone in her English class to complete the survey and they all did!

context.potentialUses: The questions can help recommend a club to join based on your interests and personality.
context.potentialMisuses: The data only came from people in our school and community - be careful about using it in different schools.

smoker.description: Whether the person smokes or not.

region.description: the beneficiary's residential area in the US, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest.

charges.description: Individual medical costs billed by health insurance.

context.potentialUses: Can be used to predict whether or not someone is a smoker based on other insurance information

Sex.description: The sex of the abalone: M, F, or I (Infant).

Length.description: Its length at the longest point in millimeters.

Height.description: Its height with the snail in the shell in millimeters.

Whole weight.description: The weight of the entire abalone in grams.

Shucked weight.description: The weight of the snail with the shell removed in grams.

Viscera weight.description: The weight of the viscera, in grams.

Shell weight.description: The weight of the shell after being dried, in grams.

card.description: This dataset contains various attributes of different abalone, a type of marine snails. The goal is to predict the number of rings in the abalone's shell, which is an indicator of its age.

context.potentialUses: Determine the age of an abalone.

Ground Beef.description: Did the taco have ground beef?

Hot Sauce.description: Did the taco have hot sauce?

Sour Cream.description: Did the taco have sour cream?

card.description: Survey of customers in a taco shop on whether or not they like certain taco combinations.

context.potentialUses: Help make recommendations for what kind of taco a new customer should buy.
context.potentialMisuses: Anything other than taco recommendations.

Star host name.description: The name of the start this exoplanet is orbiting.

Number of stars.description: Number of stars in the exoplanet's system.

Number of planets.description: Number of planets in the exoplanet's system.

Discovery year.description: The year this exoplanet was discovered.

Orbit length in earth days.description: How long it takes for this planet to make a complete orbit around its host star, measured in earth days.

Size in earths.description: The relative size of this exoplanet in comparison to earth.

Mass in earths.description: The relative mass of this exoplanet in comparison to earth.

Star temperature in kelvin.description: The temperature of the host star in kelvin.

Star size in suns.description: The relative size of the host star in comparison to the sun.

Star mass in suns.description: The relative mass of the host star in comparison to the sun.

Star age in billions of years.id: Star age in billions of years
Star age in billions of years.description: The age of the host star.

card.description: This dataset is a list of exoplanets, which are planets orbiting other stars. With this data, it's possible to estimate the size of an exoplanet as well as other characteristics.

context.potentialUses: Estimate the size or mass of an exoplanet based on the size, age or other aspects of the star it orbits.
context.potentialMisuses: Trying to make guesses as to whether a planet could support life.

Away team alias.description: Abbreviation of the name of the away team.

Home team alias.description: Abbreviation of the name of the home team.

Time in seconds.description: Time elasped on the game clock, in seconds.

Jersey number.description: The number of the player who took the shot.

Inches from left baseline.description: Distance from the left baseline (the line behind a basket).

Inches from bottom sideline.description: Distance from the bottom sideline (the line along the length of the court).

Made or miss.description: Whether the 3-point shot was made or missed.

card.description: This dataset contains every 3-point attempt made during the NCAA 2017 tournament. With this data it's possible to predict whether the shot was made or missed.

context.potentialUses: Predict whether a 3-point shot was made or missed.

color.description: Which of these colors do you like the most?

music.description: Which of these types of music do you like the most?

food.description: Which of these types of foods do you like the most?

read vs tv.description: How do you feel about the following statement: "I would rather read than watch TV"

club.description: What is a club you would want to join or are already a part of?

card.description: Isaac and his four siblings asked everyone in their classes to fill out the survey. This led to a lot of data from people across many different groups.

context.potentialUses: The questions can help recommend a club to join based on your interests and personality.
context.potentialMisuses: The data only came from people in our school and community - be careful about using it in different schools.

vanilla.description: Does the raspado include vanilla toppings?

mango.description: Does the raspado include mango toppings?

lime.description: Does the raspado include lime toppings?

chili en polbo.description: Does the raspado include chile en polbo toppings?

lechera.description: Does the raspado include lechera toppings?

coconut.description: Does the raspado include coconut toppings?

preference.description: Do you like or dislike the raspado?

card.description: Survey of customers in a raspado shop on whether or not they like certain raspado combinations.

context.potentialUses: Help make recommendations for what kind of raspado a new customer should order.
context.potentialMisuses: Anything other than recommendations.

avocado.description: Does the poke have avocado mixed in?

onion.description: Does the poke have onion mixed in?

masago.description: Does the poke have masago mixed in?

wasabi.description: Does the poke have wasabi mixed in?

ginger.description: Does the poke have ginger mixed in?

seaweed.description: Does the poke have seaweed mixed in?

furikake.description: Does the poke have furikake mixed in?

surimi.description: Does the poke have surimi mixed in?

chili.description: Does the poke have chili mixed in?

preference.description: Do you like or dislike the poke?

card.description: Survey of customers in a poke shop on whether or not they like certain poke combinations.

context.potentialUses: Help make recommendations for what kind of poke a new customer should buy.
context.potentialMisuses: Anything other than recommendations.

Resting Blood Pressure.description: Whether they have chest pain, and if so whether it is anginal: a feeling like your heart is being squeezed.

Fasting Blood Sugar > 120mg/dl.description: Whether or not their fasting blood sugar is high (above 120).

Resting ECG Results.description: The results of an echycardiogram: whether there are abnormalities detected in their heart.

Maximum Heart Rate Achieved.description: During an exercise test, the highest the patient's heart rate reached.

Exercise Induced Angina.description: Whether or not exercise induced angina in the patient

ST Depression Induced By Exercise Relati.id: ST Depression Induced By Exercise Relative To Rest
ST Depression Induced By Exercise Relati.description: The rate of ST depression (artery issues) caused by exercise, an indicator of heart issues.

Slope of Peak Exercise ST Segment.id: Slope of Peak Exercise ST Segment
Slope of Peak Exercise ST Segment.description: The slope of their ST segment (the artery being measured) during exercise.

Number of Major Vessels Colored by Flour.id: Number of Major Vessels Colored by Flourosopy
Number of Major Vessels Colored by Flour.description: Fluoroscopy is a process of mapping arteries to the heart: this shows how many blood vessels were highly visible in the process. A low or high number may correspond to heart disease.

Diagnosis of Heart Disease.description: Whether or not the patient has heart disease.

card.description: A dataset of test results for heart disease patients, used to predict whether or not someone may have heart disease.

context.potentialUses: Diagnose whether someone may be at risk for heart disease based on various factors.

activity.description: Which of these activities did you do within the last month?

pet you own.description: Which of these pets do you own?

favorite movie.description: Which of these movies do you like the most?

lunch food.description: Which of these foods would you eat for lunch?

club.description: What is a club you would want to join or are already a part of?

card.description: Kim asked her older sister what questions she should put in the survey, then sent the survey in an email to her sister's friends at the private university where she goes to school.

context.potentialUses: The questions can help recommend a club to join based on your interests and personality.
context.potentialMisuses: The data only came from people in our school and community - be careful about using it in different schools.

activity.description: Which of these activities do you like the most?

free time.description: How much free time do you have after school?

personality.description: How do you like to spend your time?

element.description: Which of these elements is your favorite?

school minutes.description: How long does it take you to get to school?

make build.description: How do you feel about the following statement: "I like to make and build things with my hands"

meet people.description: How do you feel about the following statement: "I like to learn new things and meet new people"

club.description: What is a club you would want to join or are already a part of?

card.description: Nico's dad is in a band and sent an email to everyone on their fan club email list. Most people on the email list filled out the form.

context.potentialUses: The questions can help recommend a club to join based on your interests and personality.
context.potentialMisuses: The data only came from people in our school and community - be careful about using it in different schools.

lions.description: Number of lions seen during a visit.

people.description: Amount of total people on safari during a visit.

dayOfMonth.description: The day of the month (1-31) of a visit.

ticketRevenue.description: The profit of the safari company on the day of a visit.

antelope.description: Number of antelope seen during a visit.

rhino.description: Number of rhinos seen during a visit.

elephant.description: Number of elephants seen during a visit.

alligator.description: Number of alligators seen during a visit.

trees.description: Number of overgrowth and trees providing shade seen during the visit.

mosquitos.description: Number of mosquitos seen during the visit.

overgrowthPercent.description: Percent of the land that has grass and bushes and shrubbery during a visit.

card.description: Data collected from 'African Safari Tours', a company that offers tours of the Serengeti plains in Africa.

context.potentialUses: Can be used to determine the best times to visit the safari to make sure you see the most amount of wildlife.
context.potentialMisuses: Only certain types of animals are tracked, so avoid jumping to conclusions on animals that are not a part of this set (like zebras or hippopotamus).

Prioritising workload.description: I try to do tasks as soon as possible and not leave them until last minute

Workaholism.description: I often study or work even in my spare time.

Reliability.description: I am reliable at work and always complete all tasks given to me.

Friends versus money.description: I would rather have lots of friends than lots of money.

Funniness.description: I always try to be the funniest one.

Judgment calls.description: I can tell if people listen to me or not when I talk to them.

Assertiveness.description: I am not afraid to give my opinion if I feel strongly about something.

card.description: A dataset of survey responses gathered by Slovak students aged 18-21 at FSEV UK. Most responses are rankings on a scale from 1 to 5. For example, 'Rank from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree): I often study or work even in my spare time'. This is a subset of the larger dataset that just focuses on personality statements.

context.potentialUses: For example, predict someone's personality traits based on other traits.
context.potentialMisuses: Using demographic information from a limited dataset to make assumptions about subgroups of people: for example, asking predictions about which genders are more likely to have which fears.

Rank.description: Their wealth rank for the year of this record.

Year.description: The year of the rankings (1996, 2001, or 2014).

Company Founding Year.description: The year their company was founded.

Company Relationship.description: Their relationship to the company: e.g. "founder", "CEO", "chairman").

Company Sector.description: The sector their company is in, e.g. "Finance" or "Software".

Company Type.description: The type of company: whether it was new, a privatized company, or an acquired company.

Citizenship.description: The country where they are an official citizen.

Region.description: The region their country of residence is in, e.g. "North America" or "East Asia"

Type Of Wealth.description: Their type of wealth, e.g. : "founder non-finance", "inherited", "self-made finance"

Net Worth In Billions.description: Their net worth in billions of dollars.

Wealth Category.description: Their category of wealth, e.g. "Financial", "Non-Traded", or "Traded Sectors".

Wealth Industry.description: The industry their wealth is in.

Wealth Inherited.description: Whether their wealth was inherited and where from, e.g. "not inherited", "father", "3rd generation".

card.description: Multi-decade data on individual billionaires, ranked for each year, with features like age, industry, family wealth, and wealth type (e.g. company founder in the finance industry).

context.potentialUses: Predict the type of a billionare's wealth based on other features.
context.potentialMisuses: For example, determining whether men are 'better' at becoming billionaires than women. Women are underrepresented among billionaires, but there are a lot of reasons for that the data doesn't reflect.

Preference.description: Did you like the ice cream cone?

card.description: Survey of customers in an ice cream shop on whether or not they like certain ice cream combinations.

context.potentialUses: Help make recommendations for what kind of ice cream a new customer should buy.
context.potentialMisuses: Anything other than ice cream recommendations.

Year.description: The year of the survey results.

Life Ladder.description: The subjective well-being score, as the average of the response to a question of life evaluation: "Please imagine a ladder, with steps numbered from 0 at the bottom to 10 at the top. The top of the ladder represents the best possible life for you and the bottom of the ladder represents the worst possible life for you. On which step of the ladder would you say you personally feel you stand at this time?"

GDP per capita.description: The country's GDP per capita in dollars.

Social support.description: This is the national average of a 0 (no) or 1 (yes) response to the question 'If you were in trouble, do you have relatives or firends you can count on to help you whenever you need them?'

Healthy life expectancy at birth.description: Healthy life expectancy at birth, based on data from the World Health Organization global Health Observatory.

Freedom to make life choices.description: The national average of a 0 (no) to 1 (yes) response to the question "Are you satisfied or dissatisfied with your freedom to choose what you do with your life?"

Generosity.description: The national average of a response to the question "Have you donated money to a charity in the past month?"

Perceptions of corruption.description: The national average of the response to two 0-1 questions: "Is corruption widespread throughout the government or not" and "Is corrpution widespread within businesses or not"?

Positive affect.description: The average of three positive measures, asking respondents how often they experience happiness, how often they experience enjoyment, and how often they smile or laugh.

Negative affect.description: The average of three negative measures, asking how often respondents feel worry, sadness, or anger.

card.description: 2019 Global Happiness report rankings, where countries are rated on different attributes that contribute to a total happiness score then ranked. The features in this dataset are taken from the years 2008 to 2018, which were averaged together for the report to create scores. This 'raw' data contains more rows than the 'Global Happiness 2019' dataset, but may give different results.

context.potentialUses: Predict a country's happiness score based on other features like GDP per capita and freedom to make life choices.
context.potentialMisuses: Predicting rank is difficult. This also shouldn't be used as an objective metric for which countries are 'best' - what factors might contribute to these scores that aren't covered by the data?

Aquatic.description: Does the animal live in water?

Backbone.description: Does the animal have a backbone?

Legs.description: How many legs does the animal have?

Tail.description: Does the animal have a tail?

Catsize.description: Is the animal around the size of a cat?

Class.description: What kind of animal is it?

card.description: A small dataset of different animal attributes (whether they have hair, feathers, teeth, and more) used for classification purposes. Almost all features are Yes/No except for Animal Name, Class, and Number of Legs.

context.potentialUses: There are lots of potential labels here, but one easy investigation to get you started is to try and find which features tend to relate to an animal being venomous.
context.potentialMisuses: This is a dataset of only 100 animals, so there may be lots of animals that aren't reflected by the data. Take it with a grain of salt!

sides.description: Number of sides the shape has

background color.description: Color of the background behind the shape

card.description: Extracted features from a visual dataset showing different shapes.

context.potentialUses: Used to train AI Bot on how to classify shapes.
context.potentialMisuses: Anything other than the purpose above.

chocolate chips.description: Does the cookie have chocolate chips?

m and ms.description: Does the cookie have m & ms?

ice cream on top.description: Does the cookie have ice cream on top?

preference.description: Do you like or dislike the cookie?
